Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.common.util.timer

Class CountDownTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.network.common.util.timer.CountDownTimer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable
    public class CountDownTimer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable
    A Timer class to perform countdown from currentSeconds all way down to 0. This class extends the Observable interface, so the caller of CountDownTimer can be notified when the timer expires, stops/pauses, or is being updated and the countdown performs from a slightly different value of time.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger currentSeconds
      Time left in seconds before the countdown expires.
      private java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService executor
      The ScheduledExecutorService responsible for the actual countdown operation.
      private java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> future
      The ScheduledFuture used to control the tick task during its execution.
      private static int INITIAL_DELAY
      Delay in seconds before the tick task is to be executed the first time.
      private java.util.List<Observer> observers
      The Observers interested in the timer execution.
      private static int PERIOD
      Time in seconds between successive tick task executions.
      private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean sendTimeUpdate
      Whether or not the timer must send updates to its Observers.
      static int STATUS_EXPIRED
      This status is used to indicate that the timer has been expired and therefore a new Game is about to start from the current Lobby with the logged Players till that moment.
      static int STATUS_STOPPED
      This status is used to indicate that the timer has been stopped or paused due to not enough Players left in the Lobby.
      static int STATUS_TIME_UPDATE
      This status is used to indicate that a time update is performed.
      private java.lang.Runnable tick
      The task to be executed every PERIOD seconds.

      void notifyObservers​(int eventStatus, int value)
      Notify all the Observers about the expiration, stop and update of the timer status by calling, for each Observer, it's Observer.onEvent(int, int) method.

      Removes an Observer from the observers List.

      Sets the value of currentSeconds to seconds, with concurrency effects as specified at AtomicInteger.set(int).
      void start()
      Starts the countdown from currentSeconds down to 0.
      void stop()
      Stops the current countdown task.

      • STATUS_EXPIRED

        public static final int STATUS_EXPIRED
        This status is used to indicate that the timer has been expired and therefore a new Game is about to start from the current Lobby with the logged Players till that moment.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_STOPPED

        public static final int STATUS_STOPPED
        This status is used to indicate that the timer has been stopped or paused due to not enough Players left in the Lobby.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_TIME_UPDATE

        public static final int STATUS_TIME_UPDATE
        This status is used to indicate that a time update is performed. This may happen only when a relevant change in the timer countdown has been detected.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • sendTimeUpdate

        private final java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean sendTimeUpdate
        Whether or not the timer must send updates to its Observers. This flag is typically true before a Game starts and becomes false after that because, as the Game begins, there is no need to continue sending lobby-related updates to the remote Players.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CountDownTimer

        public CountDownTimer​(int startingSeconds)
        This is the only constructor. It creates a new CountDownTimer that starts the countdown from the given amount of seconds.
        Parameters:
        startingSeconds - the amount of seconds to start counting from.

    • Method Detail

      • getTime

        public int getTime()
        Returns the current value of currentSeconds, with concurrency effects as specified at AtomicInteger.get().
        Returns:
        the current value of currentSeconds.

      • setTime

        public void setTime​(int seconds)
        Sets the value of currentSeconds to seconds, with concurrency effects as specified at AtomicInteger.set(int).

        There is no guarantee, other than best effort, that an invocation of this method performed by the super class at the exact same time the countdown expires, prevents the timer to actually expire and consequently perform the tick task again.

        Parameters:
        seconds - the new value of currentSeconds.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the countdown from currentSeconds down to 0. If called repeatedly before the tick task is done, the second and subsequent calls have no effect.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the current countdown task. If called called repeatedly the second and subsequent calls have no effect.

        There is no guarantee, other than best effort, that an invocation of this method performed by the super class at the exact same time the countdown expires, prevents the timer to actually expire and consequently notify the Observers.

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver​(Observer observer)
        Adds an Observer to the observers List, so that it can be notified when the timer expires.
        Specified by:
        addObserver in interface Observable
        Parameters:
        observer - the Observer to be added.

      • removeObserver

        public void removeObserver​(Observer observer)
        Removes an Observer from the observers List. This typically happens after the Observer is no longer interested in the timer expiration, or immediately after expired and don't need to repeat a countdown anymore.
        Specified by:
        removeObserver in interface Observable
        Parameters:
        observer - the Observer to be removed.

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers​(int eventStatus,
                            int value)
        Notify all the Observers about the expiration, stop and update of the timer status by calling, for each Observer, it's Observer.onEvent(int, int) method.
        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface Observable
        Parameters:
        eventStatus - the status in which the timer is found when notifying its Observers.
        value - the value value of the status event.
